svg.title: UML Class Diagram of subject of care and related concepts
svg.desc: An UML Class Diagram of the concept subject of care and the concepts related to it.

rect.title: organization or person participating in care
role played by a person
care actor other than a care provider or the subject of care

text.tspan: is expressed by subject of care

rect.title: subject of care or a subject of care proxy's perception of health needs motivating a request for care

mandate (commission) based on a commitment and either an informed consent or an authorization by law, defining the rights and obligations of one care actor with regard to his involvement in care processes performed for a specific subject of care
data repository regarding the health and care of a subject of care

text.tspan: has the right to take decisions

rect.title: person with authority to take decisions on behalf of a subject of care
care activity delay by the preference of the subject of care
activity intended to improve or maintain a health state
set of interrelated or interacting care activities which transforms inputs into outputs
person role being either the closest living relative of the subject of care or identified as the one they have a close relationship with
health record held and maintained by the subject of care or a subject of care proxy
desire expressed by the subject of care or the subject of care proxy regarding the performance of certain care activities
care activities, services, management or supplies related to the health of an individual

permission to perform care activities, voluntarily given by a subject of care with consent competence or by a subject of care proxy with consent competence, after having been informed about the purpose and the possible results of the care activities
capability of the subject of care and/or the subject of care proxy to give or withhold informed consent
subject of care desire that specific care activities are not performed
health circumstance causing a deficit in the current health state compared to aspects of a desired future health
interaction between one or more subject of care and one or more care personnel
role played by a subject of care when performing self-care
person seeking to receive, receiving, or having received care
